required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of LY3192767 in Healthy Participants
clinical_study.official_title: A Single-Site, Single Ascending Dose Study to Evaluate the Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics, and Glucodynamic Effects of LY3192767 in Healthy Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: The main purpose of this study is to investigate the side effects related to LY3192767 when given as an injection under the skin to healthy participants. Blood tests will be done to check how much LY3192767 is absorbed into the bloodstream, how long it takes for the body to get rid of it, and how it affects blood sugar levels. The study has two parts: Part A and Part B. Each participant will enroll in one part. For each participant, Part A will last up to about 32 days after last dose and Part B will last up to about 49 days after last dose. Screening must be completed prior to study start.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with One or More Serious Adverse Event(s) (SAEs) Considered by the Investigator to be Related to Study Drug Administration
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline through Study Completion (up to about Day 49)
primary_outcome.description: A summary of SAEs and other non-serious adverse events (AEs), regardless of causality, will be reported in the Reported Adverse Events module

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics (PK): Time to Maximum Concentration (Tmax) of LY3192767
PK: Maximum Serum Concentration (Cmax) of LY3192767
PK: Area Under the Concentration-Time Curve from Time Zero to Infinity (AUC[0-inf] of LY3192767
Pharmacodynamics (PD): Total Amount of Glucose Infused (Gtot) of LY3192767
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Predose through 36 Hours During Clamp Procedure
secondary_outcome.description: PD: Total Amount of Glucose Infused (Gtot) of LY3192767

secondary_outcome.measure: PD: Maximum Glucose Infusion Rate (Rmax) of LY3192767
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Predose through 36 Hours During Clamp Procedure

secondary_outcome.measure: PD: Time of Maximum Glucose Infusion Rate (TRmax) of LY3192767
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Predose through 36 Hours During Clamp Procedure

secondary_outcome.measure: PD: Change from Baseline in Free Fatty Acids
secondary_outcome.description: PD: Change from Baseline in Free Fatty Acids

secondary_outcome.measure: PD: Change from Baseline in Glycerol
secondary_outcome.description: PD: Change from Baseline in Glycerol

secondary_outcome.measure: PD: Change from Baseline in Triglycerides
secondary_outcome.description: PD: Change from Baseline in Triglycerides

arm_group.description: Escalating doses of LY3192767 administered subcutaneously (SC).
LY3192767 administered as a SC injection in one of three study periods.
Basal insulin peglispro administered as a SC injection in one of three study periods.
Insulin glargine administered as a SC injection in one of three study periods.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Are overtly healthy males or females, as determined by medical history and physical examination
- Have a body mass index (BMI) of >18.5 and <30.0 kilogram per square meter (kg/mÂ²), inclusive
Exclusion Criteria:
- Are currently enrolled in a clinical trial involving an investigational product or any other type of medical research judged not to be scientifically or medically compatible with this study
- Have participated, within the last 30 days, in a clinical trial involving an investigational product. If the previous investigational product has a long half-life, 3 months or 5 half-lives (whichever is longer) should have passed
- Have participated as a participant in a first-in-human study within 90 days of the initial dose of study drug
- Have known allergies to insulin, heparin, or related drugs, or history of relevant allergic reactions of any origin
- Have a history or presence of cardiovascular, respiratory, hepatic, renal, gastrointestinal, endocrine, hematological, chronic inflammatory disease, or neurological disorders capable of significantly altering the absorption, metabolism, or elimination of drugs; of constituting a risk when taking the study medication; or of interfering with the interpretation of data
